1.text: Brethren, my heart’s desire and my prayer to God are for Israel, that they may be saved.

2.text: Certainly, I testify about them that they have a zeal for God, but not according to accurate knowledge.

3.text: Being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, they did not subject themselves to the righteousness of God.

4.text: For Christ is the fulfillment of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.

5.text: Moses writes about the righteousness of the law, “The one who does them will live by them.”

6.text: But the righteousness which is of faith speaks this way, “Do not say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’ (that is, to bring Christ down);

7.text: or, ‘Who will descend into the abyss?’ (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead.)”

8.text: But what does it say? “The word is near you, in your mouth, and in your heart;” that is, the word of faith, which we preach.

9.text: If you will confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

10.text: With the heart, one believes, resulting in righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made, resulting in salvation.

11.text: As the Scripture says, “Whoever believes in him will not be disappointed.”

12.text: Indeed, there is no distinction between Jew and Greek because the same Lord is Lord of all, and he is generous to all who call on him.

13.text: For, “Whoever will call on the Name of the Lord will be saved.”

14.text: But how will they call on him in whom they have not believed? How will they believe in him whom they have not heard? How will they hear without a preacher?

15.text: And how will they preach unless they are sent? As it is written:  How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the Good News of peace,   Who bring glad tidings of good things!

16.text: Still, they did not all listen to the Good News. As Isaias (Isaiah) says, “Lord, who has believed our report?”

17.text: And so, faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.

18.text: But I say, did they not hear? Yes, most certainly:  Their sound went out into all the earth,   Their words to the ends of the world.

19.text: But I ask, did not Israel know? First, Moses says:  I will provoke you to jealousy with what is no nation,   With a nation void of understanding I will make you angry.

20.text: Isaias (Isaiah) is very bold and says:  I was found by those who did not seek me.   I was revealed to those who did not ask for me.

21.text: Yet, regarding Israel, he says:  All day long I stretched out my hands to a disobedient and opposing people.
